Overview.Summary: In the 2019 Ukrainian presidential election, comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy is leading in the polls (8, 10), followed by incumbent President Petro Poroshenko (8). Other candidates in the running include Yulia Tymoshenko (1, 3, 5, 9), Yuriy Boyko (1), Ihor Smeshko (1), Oleh Lyashko (1), Andriy Sadovy (3), Viktor Bondar (3), Oleksandr Shevchenko (3), and Dmytro Gnap (7). One of the candidates, Anatoliy Hrytsenko, is a former defense minister running on an anti-corruption platform (9). There have been concerns about election fraud (3) and potential information disclosure by ex-serviceman (6). Some candidates, such as Dmytro Gnap, have expressed willingness to drop out of the race in favor of Hrytsenko (7).

Timeline.Text: Presidential candidate Anatoliy Hrytsenko's approval rating is at 11.67% according to a poll.
Comedian Volodymyr Zelensky takes the lead in the presidential election polls.
Presidential candidates Petro Poroshenko and Volodymyr Zelensky debate ahead of the election.
Comedian Volodymyr Zelensky wins a landslide victory in the presidential election.
Presidential candidates Yulia Tymoshenko and Anatoliy Hrytsenko sign a memorandum on fair elections.
Presidential candidate Anatoliy Hrytsenko and Yulia Tymoshenko stand for a third time in the election.
Presidential candidate Dmytro Gnap announces he is ready to pull out from the race in favor of Anatoliy Hrytsenko.
Presidential candidate Volodymyr Zelensky leads in the polls, followed by Petro Poroshenko, Anatoliy Hrytsenko, and Yulia Tymoshenko.
Presidential candidate Anatoliy Hrytsenko is being checked by the Ukrainian army for information disclosure.
Presidential candidate Anatoliy Hrytsenko is the preferred candidate among democratic opposition lawmakers and activists.

Overview.Summary: Comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy was elected as the new president of Ukraine in the 2019 presidential election (1,2,5,6,7,9,10). He called for a snap election to oust Poroshenko loyalists (3) and agreed to a stadium face-off with his rival Petro Poroshenko (4). Zelenskiy's victory marks a shift in the country's political landscape (8).

Timeline.Text: A comedian and TV star, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, wins the first round of the Ukrainian presidential election by a large margin.
Volodymyr Zelenskiy continues to lead in the polls, with Yulia Tymoshenko and incumbent president Petro Poroshenko close behind.
Zelenskiy and Poroshenko agree to a stadium face-off debate, a rare event in Ukrainian politics.
Volodymyr Zelenskiy is elected as the new president of Ukraine, promising change and a departure from traditional politics.
Experts discuss the implications of the Ukrainian presidential election on the country's economy and foreign relations.
President Zelenskiy calls for a snap election to oust loyalists of former prime minister Yulia Tymoshenko.

Overview.Summary: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, a former comedian, won the 2019 Ukrainian presidential election with 73% of the vote (1,2,4,8). In his inaugural address, he promised to protect the sovereignty and independence of Ukraine and to work for the good of the people (9,10). Zelenskyy also called for a snap parliamentary election in hopes of consolidating his power (2,3,7). He met with NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg and reaffirmed Ukraine's commitment to join the EU and NATO (6). Zelenskyy also reinstated the Ukrainian citizenship of former Georgian President Mikheil Saakashvili (7). His victory represents a hope for change and a desire for someone to solve Ukraine's problems (1).

Timeline.Text: Volodymyr Zelenskyy runs far ahead of all other candidates in the first round of the Ukrainian presidential election.
Volodymyr Zelenskyy takes office as the new president of Ukraine and announces a snap parliamentary election.
Zelenskyy, a former comedian, is inaugurated as Ukraine's sixth president.
Zelenskyy reinstates the Ukrainian citizenship of former Georgian president Mikheil Saakashvili.
Zelenskyy visits NATO Headquarters in Brussels and reaffirms Ukraine's commitment to seeking full-fledged membership.
Zelenskyy meets with NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg and discusses Ukraine's aspirations for membership.

Overview.Summary: Ukrainian comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy won the 2019 Ukrainian presidential election in a landslide victory (1,7,8). His campaign lacked substance but was aggressive and successful (1). Zelenskiy is a political newcomer who rose to fame as a television actor and satirist (1,2,3). He was officially sworn in as the sixth president of Ukraine on May 20, 2019 (9). His victory was a surprise to Ukraine's political elite (8). Zelenskiy defeated the incumbent president, Petro Poroshenko (6,7,8,10).

Timeline.Text: Volodymyr Zelensky, a comedian and political newcomer, takes a big lead in the Ukrainian presidential election.
Volodymyr Zelensky wins a landslide victory in Ukraine's presidential election, defeating incumbent Petro Poroshenko.
Volodymyr Zelensky is declared the next president of Ukraine.
The Central Election Commission officially presents the results of the presidential election, confirming Volodymyr Zelensky as the winner.
Volodymyr Zelensky is inaugurated as the sixth president of Ukraine.

Overview.Summary: The 2019 Ukrainian presidential election featured 39 candidates, including Yuriy Boyko (2, 3, 4, 5, 7). Boyko, who is known for his pro-Russian views, trailed far behind the frontrunner, comedian Volodymyr Zelensky (1, 6, 8, 9, 10) in opinion polls. Zelensky ultimately won the election with a landslide victory (8, 9, 10). Boyko met with Russian Prime Minister Dmitry Medvedev to discuss gas supplies (3, 5).

Timeline.Text: Yuriy Boyko is listed as one of the top candidates in the upcoming Ukrainian presidential election.
Yuriy Boyko is among the top candidates in the Ukrainian presidential race, with around 10% support in opinion polls.
Yuriy Boyko, a pro-Russian candidate, meets with the Russian prime minister to discuss gas supplies.
Comedian Volodymyr Zelensky wins the first round of the Ukrainian presidential election, with Yuriy Boyko trailing far behind.
Yuriy Boyko, a former deputy prime minister, is listed among the record-breaking 44 candidates running in the Ukrainian presidential race.
Volodymyr Zelensky, a comedian, wins a landslide victory in the Ukrainian presidential election, beating out incumbent Petro Poroshenko and other candidates such as Yuriy Boyko.
The official results of the Ukrainian presidential election are announced, showing Volodymyr Zelensky as the winner over Petro Poroshenko and other candidates such as Yuriy Boyko.

Overview.Summary: On April 21, 2019, Ukrainian comedian Volodymyr Zelensky won the presidential election in a landslide victory (1, 3, 5, 10). Zelensky, who initially brushed off by Ukraine's political elite, ran a successful and aggressive campaign (1). The election took place in two rounds, with Zelensky leading in the first round on April 1 (4). Zelensky's victory has been seen as a walloping rebuke to Ukraine's political class (9).

Overview.Summary: The 2019 Ukrainian presidential election is a highly contested event, with comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy leading the polls (2,5,7,8,9). Zelenskiy has called for the dissolution of parliament and snap elections (5,8,10). Other candidates include Petro Poroshenko (1,2,9), Yulia Tymoshenko (2,4,9), Yuriy Boyko (2), Anatoliy Hrytsenko (2,4,9), Ihor Smeshko (2), and Oleh Lyashko (2,6). There are concerns about possible falsification of the election results (4). Oligarchs have also been accused of using their TV channels to influence the election (6).

Timeline.Text: Volodymyr Zelenskiy wins the Ukrainian presidential election by a landslide with 73.2% of the votes.
Oligarchs use their TV channels to influence the election agenda, including promoting Yulia Tymoshenko, Oleh Liashko, and Anatoliy Hrytsenko.
In the first round of the presidential election, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, a comedian who plays an accidental president on television, delivers a walloping rebuke to the political class.
Comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy leads the presidential contest according to the BBC.
The BBC provides the latest content about the Ukrainian presidential election.
Ahead of the presidential runoff election, President Petro Poroshenko and comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy debate.
After being sworn in, President Volodymyr Zelenskiy dissolves parliament and calls for snap elections.
Presidential adviser suggests a snap parliamentary election may take place on July 21.

Overview.Summary: The 2019 Ukrainian presidential election took place on March 31 (9) and was won by Ukrainian comedian Volodymyr Zelensky (1,2,4,5,8). He was officially declared the winner by the Central Election Commission (5). Zelensky has signed a constitutional amendment in support of NATO and EU membership (3) and has dissolved parliament, calling for snap elections (7). The presidential candidates, including Zelensky and incumbent Petro Poroshenko, held a debate ahead of the election (6). Zelensky's victory was seen as a rebuke to the country's political class (9). The election had a record-breaking number of candidates (10).

Timeline.Text: Comedian Volodymyr Zelensky takes the lead in the first round of the Ukrainian presidential election.
Ukrainian comedian who plays an accidental president on television delivers a walloping rebuke to the country's political class in the presidential election.
Volodymyr Zelensky wins the first round of the Ukrainian presidential election by a landslide.
Zelenskiy is officially declared the winner of the Ukrainian presidential election.
Zelenskyy is sworn in as Ukraine's sixth president.
Ukraine's new president, Volodymyr Zelensky, announces a snap parliamentary election.
Ukraine's presidential race officially begins with a record-breaking 44 candidates.
Ukrainian President Poroshenko warns against using populist and nationalist tactics during the upcoming election.
Presidential candidates President Petro Poroshenko and Volodymyr Zelenskiy hold their only debate before the election.
Zelensky is inaugurated as Ukraine's new president.

Overview.Summary: In the 2019 Ukrainian presidential election, Volodymyr Zelenskiy, a comedian and political novice, won in a landslide victory over incumbent Petro Poroshenko (10, 3, 6). Poroshenko had been backed by Germany's Angela Merkel, who refused to meet with Zelenskiy (1,4). Zelenskiy and Poroshenko also faced off in a rare stadium debate (6). The election was seen as a battle between oligarchs, with Poroshenko being backed by one of the country's wealthiest businessmen (8). Poroshenko also claimed that another tycoon was backing Zelenskiy in revenge (9). Zelenskiy has promised to move Ukraine closer to NATO and the European Union (2,5).

Timeline.Text: Ukrainian President Petro Poroshenko signs a constitutional amendment committing the country to becoming a member of NATO and the European Union.
President Poroshenko claims that a tycoon has backed his rivals for revenge.
Comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy and President Poroshenko agree to a stadium face-off ahead of the election.
German Chancellor Angela Merkel meets with President Poroshenko, but does not meet with his election rival.
Comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy maintains a lead over President Poroshenko in opinion polls for the upcoming runoff election.
The runoff election between President Poroshenko and comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy is seen as a battle between oligarchs.
Comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy defeats President Poroshenko in a landslide victory.
Ukraine's new Orthodox church, backed by President Poroshenko, has enthroned its leading cleric.
President Poroshenko calls for snap elections at his swearing-in ceremony.
President Poroshenko loses the Ukrainian presidential election to comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy.

Political violence mars the Nigerian presidential election, which results in the reelection of President Muhammadu Buhari.

Overview.Summary: The 2019 Ukrainian presidential election has 44 candidates (6) including current president Petro Poroshenko (1,2,7,8,10) and former prime minister Yulia Tymoshenko (1,3,4,5,6,7,9,10). Tymoshenko has accused Poroshenko of fraud (1) and has been a frontrunner in the polls until recently (3,5). She has also spent the most on her campaign (9) and has a good chance of being elected in the second round of the elections (9). The third frontrunner in the election is comedian Volodymyr Zelensky (2,5,8,10).

Timeline.Text: Former prime minister Yulia Tymoshenko accuses incumbent Petro Poroshenko's campaign of fraud in the upcoming Ukrainian presidential election.
Yulia Tymoshenko, a former prime minister and two-time prisoner, is running in the Ukrainian presidential election.
Comedian Volodymyr Zelensky takes the lead in opinion polls for the Ukrainian presidential election, overtaking Yulia Tymoshenko.
Ukrainians prepare to vote in the presidential election, with no clear favorite between incumbent Petro Poroshenko and Yulia Tymoshenko.
Comedian Volodymyr Zelensky agrees to debate incumbent Petro Poroshenko in a stadium event, while Yulia Tymoshenko calls for a drug test before the debate.
Comedian Volodymyr Zelensky takes the lead in the Ukrainian presidential election, with Yulia Tymoshenko in third place.
Yulia Tymoshenko has a good chance of being elected president in the second round of the Ukrainian presidential election.

98.Snippet: Ahead of Sunday's presidential runoff election President Petro Poroshenko and comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy held their only debate at a football stadium. Polls show Poroshenko losing to Zelenskiy.

99.Title: Zelenskiy Defeats Ukrainian President Poroshenko On Anti-Corruption ...
99.Snippet: With nearly all the ballots counted, the 41-year-old Volodymyr Zelenskiy took 73% of the vote, trouncing incumbent President Petro Poroshenko, who received less than 25%.

100.Title: Ukrainian 2019 presidential elections: Live updates

101.Title: Comedian Zelenskiy wins Ukrainian presidency in landslide
101.Snippet: KIEV — Volodymyr Zelenskiy, a comedian and political novice, scored a crushing victory over incumbent Petro Poroshenko in Ukraine’s runoff presidential vote Sunday, in a resounding rebuke to the country’s political establishment.

Overview.Summary: Ukrainian comedian Volodymyr Zelenskiy won the 2019 Ukrainian presidential election by a landslide (8, 9, 11, 15, 19, 20). His victory was not a surprise, as he led in the first round of elections (1, 2, 5, 10) and was seen as a candidate who could solve the country's problems (1). Zelenskiy's campaign was met with accusations of fraud from rival candidate Yulia Tymoshenko (6). He was officially named the new president on April 30 (18) and called for snap parliamentary elections in May (12, 13). Zelenskiy's victory was seen as a rejection of the political elite in Ukraine (14) and he has expressed a desire for his country to join the EU and NATO (15, 19). However, his lack of political experience has raised concerns (14).

Timeline.Text: Comedian Volodymyr Zelensky leads the first round of the Ukrainian presidential election.
Volodymyr Zelensky wins the Ukrainian presidential election in a landslide victory.
The Central Election Commission officially announces Zelensky's victory in the presidential election.
Zelensky is inaugurated as the sixth president of Ukraine and announces a snap parliamentary election.
CSIS publishes an article discussing Zelensky's rise from a comedian to the president of Ukraine.
Zelensky meets with NATO Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg and reaffirms Ukraine's commitment to join the EU and NATO.
President Donald Tusk welcomes Zelensky to Brussels for his first foreign visit as the president of Ukraine.
